security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate PDF manipulation skill containing 8 Python scripts for document processing. The 227 static findings are false positives: documentation examples showing command syntax are not actual shell execution; legitimate file I/O uses standard PDF libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber); cryptographic references are for PDF password protection; and flagged keywords like 'command' appear only in documentation context. No network calls, no command injection, no credential handling.

low_findings.title: User-specified file paths accessed
low_findings.description: Scripts accept file paths as command-line arguments for PDF processing. Expected behavior for document tools.

content.value_statement: PDF documents require specialized tools for extraction, modification, and form filling. This skill provides comprehensive PDF processing capabilities including text extraction, table detection, document merging, splitting, and form field manipulation using Python libraries.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDF documents
Merge multiple PDFs into a single document
Fill PDF forms with data (fillable and non-fillable)
Create new PDFs from scratch with text and images
Convert PDF pages to images for visual analysis
limitations: Requires Python libraries: pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab, pdf2image
Cannot process password-protected PDFs without the password
OCR requires pytesseract installation for scanned documents
Form filling on non-fillable PDFs requires visual bounding box analysis

best_practices: Validate PDF files before processing to handle corrupted or encrypted documents gracefully
Use bounding box validation when filling non-fillable PDF forms to ensure accurate placement
Process large PDFs in chunks to manage memory usage effectively
anti_patterns: Attempting to process password-protected PDFs without first obtaining the password
Skipping bounding box validation when filling non-fillable PDF forms
Processing extremely large PDFs without chunking or memory management

faq.question: What Python libraries are required?
faq.answer: Install pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab, and pdf2image using pip. OCR features need pytesseract.

faq.question: What are the size limits for PDF processing?
faq.answer: Performance depends on available memory. Very large documents should be processed in sections.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, Python scripts can be called from any AI tool or integrated into larger document processing workflows.

faq.question: Is data from PDFs stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. All processing occurs locally. Files are read from and written to paths you specify.

faq.question: Why did form filling fail?
faq.answer: Common causes include: PDF is encrypted, form fields are not properly detected, or bounding boxes overlap.

faq.question: How does this compare to online PDF tools?
faq.answer: This skill runs locally for privacy, handles batch operations, and can be automated in AI workflows.
